arm_group.description: 6 week Steps To Active Kids (STAK) physical activity programme (combined supervised and home-based physical activity).

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to test the feasibility of a physical activity intervention called the Steps
      To Active Kids (STAK) programme in children aged 9 - 11 years with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus
      (T1DM). The STAK programme promotes physical activity in children who have a chronic
      condition, low levels of physical activity, are overweight or who lack confidence to take
      part in physical activity. The intervention involves an Activity Diary, circuit training,
      pedometer step  counting, daily physical activity monitoring and goal setting to promote
      long-term increases in physical activity and its associated health benefits. This randomised
      single-centre feasibility study will test whether the STAK programme is feasible for
      children with T1DM, in terms of acceptability, attractiveness and compliance and a
      qualitative process evaluation will aid the assessment of feasibility.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physical Activity in Children With Type 1 Diabetes Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Be aged between 9 and 11 years

          -  Have a clinical diagnosis of Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus for at least 3 months

          -  Be willing and able to comply with the study protocol

          -  Be physically able to participate in physical activity

          -  Have a parent/carer who provides informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Be under the age of 9 years and over the age of 11 years

          -  Have been diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus for less than 3 months

          -  Have an injury or physical health condition that precludes their participation in
             physical activity

          -  Have a psychiatric disorder that interferes with provision of assent, completion of
             measurements, intervention, or follow-up

          -  Insufficient proficiency in English to comply with treatment or provide data

intervention.description: 6 week programme of combined supervised and home-based (non-supervised) physical activity.

clinical_study.official_title: The Feasibility of a Physical Activity Intervention for Children With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus: Steps To Active Kids (STAK)

other_outcome.description: Demographic questionnaire administered at baseline only.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility: number of participants at baseline and follow-up

primary_outcome.description: Attendance at physical activity sessions and completion of activity diary
primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility: Rate of adherence to the intervention
Feasibility: number of participants with adverse events

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in children's self-efficacy using CSAPPA scale (Children's Self‐Perceptions of Adequacy in and Predilection for Physical Activity)
Change in children's level of physical activity (measured subjectively via self-report questionnaire)

secondary_outcome.description: Accelerometers will measure physical activity at 0 weeks and 6 weeks in the intervention group only (before and after the 6 week physical activity programme)
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in children's physical activity (measured using ActiGraph accelerometers)

secondary_outcome.description: Data collected as routine clinic procedure and will be used to assess changes in HbA1c and BMI from baseline to follow-up.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in clinical outcome measures (Hba1c, height, weight)
Change in parental hypoglycaemia fear using the Hypoglycaemia Fear Survey (HFS-Parent)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label
